intro: Lyperanthus glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, often violet or blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and glandular, which helps in reducing water loss. It is often found in open habitats such as shrublands and grasslands.
